derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (originally also as ambassy denoting the position of ambassador): from Old French ambasse, based on Latin ambactus 'servant'. Compare with ambassador

entry.def: An embassy is a group of government officials, headed by an ambassador, who represent their government in a foreign country. The building in which they work is also called an embassy .

example.ex: The American Embassy has already complained...
example.tran: 美国大使馆已经提出了抗议。

example.ex: Mr Cohen held discussions at the embassy with one of the rebel leaders.
example.tran: 科恩先生在大使馆和其中一个叛军头目进行了磋商。

means.word_mean: 1. a diplomatic building where ambassadors live or work
2. an ambassador and his entourage collectively
